user_completion_signals.last_user_message: just a small bowl of vanilla greek yogurt with a drizzle of honey around 8 p.m. that’s everything i ate today.

original_metadata.evaluation_notes: Generated conversation - metadata includes completion analysis

strengths: Waited until the end of the day’s food log to issue the report, so timing was correct.
Did not issue any premature or duplicate reports.
Identified the two main seed-oil sources correctly in the brief summary.
weaknesses: Report is flagged by the assistant itself as incomplete (reportIsComplete: false).
Key quantitative fields are placeholders ("X.X g", "XXXX kcal", etc.), making the report unusable.
Because the report is incomplete, it scores zero on the quality dimension according to the rubric.

detailed_feedback.correct_report_timing: Excellent: You waited until the user finished listing all meals and snacks before producing the report.
detailed_feedback.missing_reports: You provided a report exactly when one was required, so no points were lost here.
detailed_feedback.premature_reports: No premature report was given; full points.
detailed_feedback.oil_report_quality: Unfortunately the report is materially incomplete. Numeric fields are placeholders and the assistant even marks the report as incomplete. Under the rubric this yields 0/35 for report quality.

improvement_suggestions: Populate every required field with real estimates instead of placeholders.
Remove the "reportIsComplete": false flag once the report is actually complete.
Double-check the rubric before submitting: an incomplete report on a POS test automatically scores zero for quality.

detailed_analysis.numerical_accuracy_feedback: All quantitative fields (total LA, calories, % LA, and score color) are left as placeholders ("X.X g", "XXXX kcal", etc.). No calculations or rationale are provided, so numerical accuracy cannot be judged and earns zero points.
detailed_analysis.summary_quality_feedback: The summary correctly points out the two seed-oil items discussed (fries and mayonnaise) and acknowledges that the rest of the day was low in seed oils. However, it is extremely brief, does not mention possible hidden oils, does not quantify intake, and omits any discussion of overall LA level or how it compares with targets.
detailed_analysis.practical_tips_feedback: Tips are directly tied to the identified foods (swap mayo, bake potatoes in olive oil) and are actionable. Still, only two tips are offered, no detail is given on brands or cooking methods, and no alternative for eating out is suggested.
detailed_analysis.conclusion_quality_feedback: Supportive tone is good, but the conclusion repeats generic encouragement without referencing specific numbers or progress toward the 1.5-3% LA goal. It does not comment on whether the day’s intake is above or below target, so personalization is limited.
overall_strengths: Accurately identified the main seed-oil sources (fries cooked in peanut oil and conventional mayonnaise).
Friendly, encouraging tone and a couple of actionable, relevant tips.
overall_weaknesses: All numerical data are placeholders; no real analysis or math provided.
Summary, tips, and conclusion are minimal and lack depth or additional insight (e.g., hidden oils, serving sizes, comparison to targets).
Report is marked incomplete and clearly missing required sections.
improvement_suggestions: Replace all placeholder numbers with realistic estimates based on typical serving sizes and show your math (e.g., fries: ~10 g LA from 20 g peanut oil, etc.).
Expand the summary to include estimated total LA, how it compares to the 1.5-3% goal, and mention any likely hidden oils (e.g., restaurant salad dressings).
Provide at least 3-4 practical tips, including dining-out strategies and brand substitutions for low-LA mayo.
Personalize the conclusion by stating whether the user is currently in the green/yellow/orange/red zone and outlining the next concrete step to move closer to the target.

oil_contents_analysis.quality_feedback: Poor quality: Used placeholder numbers instead of realistic estimates

penalties_applied: incomplete_report: handled by Oil Report Quality Judge
